title: Since Xypherous confirmed Eve is kept trash on purpose.
body:
How about you just get rid of stealth altogether then. Since it is beyond clear that:
-You hate the mechanism.
-You absolutely cannot balance it whatsoever.
-You don't care about having champions kept purposely weak because of it.
I'm honestly not sure why you can't deal with stealth. Dota, HoN and even now Heroes of the storm all have permanently stealthed units, and it works fine for them, sure you could say stealth is a mechanic that isn't really fun for some players to play against, but if that was just the case you would never dare to introduce horrible monstrosity to the game like fucking Kalista.

tl;dr
Just get rid of stealth, you have no idea what to do with it anyway.
Buff Eve's stats and make her a playable champion again.

replies.body:
Riot is testing a new ward-like item on PBE that would create counterplay to her permastealth and allow buffing her. It's not like they completely ignore her.
EDIT: [Mandrake Ward](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/Gvu9AMil-experimental-wip-217-mandrake-ward)
Hopefully they put it in the game and it allows them to safely buff Eve, Rengar, and Shaco's Assassin playstyles.
They are planning to tear down and rebuild Eve for sure I think due to her kit and identity not being the best organised
Yea but she not even in the works right now. Which translates to: not being touched for the next 3 years at least.
That is one way to look at it. Another is the item is a indirect nerf to low mobility champions without gap closers.
In what way?

riot is picky,
they hate stealth, hate heal, hate mana regen, hate immobile. But they love knock up and flashy plays

I remember seeing posts like this about Eve before there were Seasons in LoL.  Back then I thought it was just simple inability on the part of the character dev team, because they were so new to game design.  It has been 5 years now and last year they made a billion dollars and can easily afford to pay skilled developers.

Now, I just think that they are paralyzed with fear and unable to do anything unless forced to by the community.  When they make changes it's only to placate and they are typically the wrong changes anyway.  It's like what we were seeing with Microsoft when Steve Ballmer was running the show, 10 years of indecision/bad decisions.

As for your specific complaint, I agree.  If they can't figure out how to work it into the game they need to strip it out and replace it.  They are wasting a lot of their content on characters that are left intentionally dormant.  If they dumped Eve's stealth and made her back into an AP jungle assassin I think it would be well received.  It'd be better than it is now anyway.

While I would love to play Eve again on a regular basis, it just wouldn't be Eve without the stealth.  I would rather she be the pathetic shadow of the character I loved to play than have her be a playable but barely recognizable rework.
I agree. Jungler gets a new pick to spice up their roster, specifically since few AP junglers are viable right now, and Eve players get to play their champion again.

Last time I saw a Ziggs I let him waste all his mana, then bullied him out of lane, and pushed him back out as soon as he came back in- every time.

just because an item is built that is a counter to a champ does not make that champion bad or below the power curve.
dropping out of the meta due to changes in anything but that champion isnt them losing power or becoming worse. whereas straight nerfs and keeping stats low IS them losing power.
ziggs does fine vs every mage. its the manaless scum that has pushed him down in pick rate. he is still REALLY strong at what he does.
malz swain and zyra are really strong and do loads and loads of damage.....but suffer vs the mobility that literally every new champ has...
amumu suffers slightly from the repeat buffs to jungle strength and lack of sustain in the jungle. which is part of an upcoming buff to tank junglers.

overall, none of those champs are bad, including twitch (no idea what made him fall out of meta? apart from him being not the best champ vs graves in lane phase...nothing was done to nerf his damage or ability to sneak kills, itemization didnt change.)

I like how you are getting downvoted when you are 100% correct.

These boards lol

No stealth eve is not eve. It would be like Karma rework 2.0.

So she has that ring around her which shows that she gets detected if too close to a champion.

What if the the detection ring was the full view range of a champion except it is in a cone where they are looking. Just tossing this out there. It would be a little more tactical to stalk or sneak up on someone but you could end up getting right up behind them.

Going to say again, just throwing out this suggestion.

That doesn't really work in a game without turn-time (or whatever that's called). You can just instantly change the direction you're facing to any with one click. (which is likely considering people don't tend to stand still in lane or anywhere)
I think the issue with this is that champion turn time in League is zero, unlike certain other MOBAs.

When Xypherous was talking about the mandrake root thingy that they are testing on the PBE, he said that the point of stealth that they are going for is the "I know they are there, but not exactly where." treatment. His whole point is that having perma-stealth is only a not ok thing if there is 0 warning. Rengar's Ult is balanced because his enemies know he is *somewhere* nearby, not exactly where, but somewhere. They want Eve to be similar to that design, so that it opens up cool mind games and flanking patterns without being 0 counterplay. He made it clear that there intention was to make this a way to indirectly nerf Eve so that they could buff her without breaking her, which is a very good thing.
simple really, just add the same type of indicator for eve that exists for rengar.
That is something that I always thought they should do, just have true sight reveal her and then have a little exclamation mark like Rengar. It seems like a simple fix really.

Riot can't balance immobile burst mages (Mordekaiser, Veigar)
Riot can't balance stealth. (Evelynn)
Riot can't balance immobile ADCs who have utility (Ashe, Varus, Urgot)

Hell, at this point, I think the only type of champion that Riot deems "healthy" are ones with ultra mobility (gap closers, escapes, repositions). So screw it, let's strip away Evelynn's unique play style. Who liked feeling like they were playing Metal Gear Solid in League of Legends anyways? Because, God forbid, we try to balance champions with truly unique play styles.

I'd rather keep stealth, personally.
Evelynn has no identity beyond stealth and killing, really. Just wait for her rework... If it ever gets here. Be glad she's still on Riot's radar. {{champion:83}} 
Shaco would require a lot of buffing in return for removing his short-duration stealth. Do you really want to see Shaco buffed? I'd rather keep him as the creepy, sneaky clown he currently is. Viable when played well.
Wukong has no good escapes without his W, and it's an integral part of his character and viability. If he can't go invisibile, he can't set up his ultimate. If he can't stealth, he can't trick his opponents with his dummy clone and standing still.
Twitch would be nothing without his stealth. He would be nothing more than a free kill for any mobile champion, unless all four of his teammates were high-CC tanks that could permanently keep enemies off of him. He might have great damage potential in his kit, but his stealth is what allows him to ever have the chance to deploy it.

If Riot can find a way to balance the Mandrake ward, we'll have our early-game counter to stealth. We already have mid and late-game counters: pink wards (including the yellow trinket upgrade) and the upgraded red trinket. If the new ward is brought into the game, Riot will have one less excuse for leaving any stealth champions in the dust— especially Eve, whose playstyle is so reliant on early, undetectable ganks.
I don't want my Eve to be changed just because RIOT "no longer likes her".

The problem is that stealth is not countered by dodging stuff and making cool plays, instead, stealth is countered by strategy and out-smarting the enemy.
Stealth works fine in DotA2 (I don't know about HoN) because in DotA2 strategy is still a really important part of the game that matters as much as dodging stuff and making plays (hell, there are heroes that have powerful skills with long range and they are point and click, and nobody complains about that being overpowered).
Meanwhile, RIOT is taking away all strategy from the game, making it a fighting game where only your skill matters in term of winning a game.
